What is HTML?: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language...
What is HTML5?: HTML5 is a new version of HTML that is designed to improve the user experience on the web.
Can you summarize the goals of HTML5 and: HTML5's goals are to provide a more user-friendly experience on the web, codify common practices, and document how browsers should deal with our imperfect markup. The element reference is a roadmap for the new features and changes in HTML5.
Can you provide an example of a flawed m: The example you provided is a flawed markup that violates HTML5's syntax.
Can you explain the difference between H: HTML5 is a new version of HTML that is designed to improve the user experience on the web. HTML4 is the previous version of HTML that is still widely used.
Can you explain the concept of validatio: Validation in HTML5 is not defined as an SGML or XML application because of the non-SGML/XML basis for HTML5.
Can you provide an example of a new feat: The new feature in HTML5 that is not yet implemented in browsers is the use of the <danger> tag.
Can you explain the concept of HTML5's \: The HTML5 "conformance checker" provides practical value because it checks for conformance to the specification, which provides the same value as validation.
